choices.text:
First, let's determine your current age and your sister's age when you were both born. Since you are currently 80 years old and your sister was half your age when you were 6, that means she was 30/2 = 15 years old at the time.
Next, we need to calculate how many years have passed since then. To do this, we can subtract your current age from your sister's age when you were both born: 80 - 15 = 65.
Finally, we can add that number of years to your sister's current
